title: Sofpironium bromide
text:
Sofpironium bromide (trade name Ecclock; development code BBI-4000) is a drug used to treat <a href="hyperhidrosis">hyperhidrosis</a> (excessive sweating). It was approved in Japan in 2020 as a 5% gel for the treament of primary axillary hyperhidrosis (PAH).
Sofpironium bromide is an <a href="anticholinergic">anticholinergic</a> agent that reduces sweating by inhibiting <a href="Muscarinic%20acetylcholine%20receptor%20M3">M3 muscarinic receptors</a> in <a href="eccrine%20gland">eccrine gland</a>s. It is a <a href="Retrometabolic%20drug%20design">retrometabolically-designed</a> drug (or "soft drug") based on <a href="glycopyrronium%20bromide">glycopyrronium bromide</a>, meaning it has been designed to exert the desired effects at the site of administration, after which it is quickly converted into an inactive non-toxic <a href="drug%20metabolism">metabolite</a> upon entering <a href="systemic%20circulation">systemic circulation</a> avoiding the typical anticholinergic side-effects caused by off-site action.
